text: Roma is a town in Queensland, Australia. It is the capital of the Maranoa Region. The town was founded in 1867 and is named after Lady Diamantina Bowen (n√©e di Roma), the wife of Sir George Bowen, the first Governor of Queensland. In the , 6,848 people lived in Roma. == References == Category:1867 establishments Category:1860s establishments in Australia Category:Towns in Queensland
title: Roma, Queensland
